free_txt: N.O.

bib_record.title: -MEASUREMENT OF THE LONG-LIVED 26-AL PRODUCTION CROSS SECTION IN THE 27-AL(N,2N) REACTION.

free_txt: M.IMAMURA, Y.UWAMINO, H.NAGAI, K.KOBAYASHI.
EXPERIMENTAL SITE.
T.NAKAMURA, H.SUGITA
THE SF CYCLOTRON OF THE INSTITUTE FOR
NUCLEAR STUDY WAS USED FOR THE NEUTRON IRRADIATION.
THE TANDEM VAN DE GRAAFF OF THE RESEARCH
CENTER FOR NUCLEAR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY WAS USED FOR
ACCELERATOR MASS SPECTROMETRY.
THE CROSS SECTIONS WERE OBTAINED BY UNFOLDING
TECHNIQUES, TAKING INTO ACCOUNT THE MEASURED INCIDENT
NEUTRON SPECTRA AT EACH PROTON ENERGY. THE UNFOLDING
WAS PERFORMED USING THE NEUPAC CODE. A CALCULATION
WITH ALICE GAVE START VALUES FOR THE UNFOLDING.
A 51 MM DIAMETER BY 51 MM LONG NE213 LIQUID
SCINTILLATOR WITH N-GAMMA DISCRIMINATION WAS USED TO
DETERMINE THE INCOMING NEUTRON SPECTRA.
INCLUDES STATISTICAL ERRORS AS WELL AS THE
UNCERTAINTIES IN THE NEUTRON SPECTRA AND THE UNFOLDING
PROCEDURE.
THE SF CYCLOTRON OF THE INSTITUTE FOR
NUCLEAR STUDY WAS USED FOR THE NEUTRON IRRADIATION.
THE TANDEM VAN DE GRAAFF OF THE RESEARCH
CENTER FOR NUCLEAR SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY WAS USED FOR
ACCELERATOR MASS SPECTROMETRY.
NEUTRONS WERE PRODUCED BY BOMBARDING A 1 MM
THICK BERYLLIUM TARGET WITH 3 - 5 MICROAMP PROTON
BEAMS OF ENERGIES 20, 22.5, 25, 27.5, 30, 32.5 AND
37.5 MEV. THE TARGET WAS BACKED BY A WATER COOLANT,
WHICH FULLY STOPPED THE PROTONS.
.THE SEMI-MONOENERGETIC NEUTRON SPECTRA AT 0 DEGREES
WERE MEASURED WITH A NE213 SCINTILLATOR PLACED 1.3 M
FROM THE BE TARGET. N-GAMMA DISCRIMINATION WAS USED
AND THE PULSE-HEIGHT DISTRIBUTIONS WERE UNFOLDED INTO
ENERGY SPECTRA WITH A REVISED FERDO CODE. ROOM-SCAT-
TERED NEUTRONS WERE ALSO MEASURED BY SHIELDING THE
DIRECT TARGET FLUX WITH A 10 CM BY 10 CM BY 50 CM LONG
SHADOW BAR.
THE 26-AL/27-AL RATIO WAS DETERMINED BY ACCELE-
RATOR MASS SEPARATION TECHNIQUES. A STANDARD SAMPLE OF
ALUMINUM-CHLORIDE FROM NBS WITH A CERTIFIED ACTIVITY
OF 38.79 DECAYS/SEC/GRAM +/- 1.1 PER-CENT WAS USED FOR
CALIBRATION.
DETECTED IN ACCELERATOR MASS SEPARATION.
.THE ALUMINUM SAMPLES WERE OF MARZ GRADE, 5 MM BY 5 MM
IN SIZE AND 50 MU THICK, WITH PURITY 99.999 PER-CENT.
THE SAMPLES WERE IRRADIATED AT TWO POSITIONS OF 5 AND
10 CM FROM THE BE TARGET FOR ABOUT 15 HR.
.DATA TAKEN FROM MAIN REF.
.DATA TAKEN FROM MAIN REF.
